page.title: 08Schools
page.content: Records are not readily available but the earliest date that the school is mentioned in local historical text is 1829.This puts the school at 156 years old.The children used to remain at the school in Brailsford until they reached 14 years of age but now they transfer to the Comprehensive School in Ashbourne,six miles away.At its peak the schoolhad about 120 pupils but in recent years the number of children on roll has been around 72.The children come from two villages,Brailsford and Shirley,as well as outlying farms.The school is organised into three classes to cover the primary age range.The school is fortunate to have its own cooking facility and dining area which enables most of the children to enjoy a good meal during the day.
